msIdentifier.collection: The Library of the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning

body.p:
You must not think me
neglectful in not having written to you before
this. Many things at times prevent me from
writing at the time and then it passes over.
No doubt ere this you have received a Letter
from Mr Myers and with it the receipt signed
by me of the Books he placed in my possession
on sale for you. I shall try and do my best
to dispose of them for you. The prices here are
too high there are so few buyers, please let
me know positively the lowest price at which
I may sell, so that I can act safely and I
will do all I can. I hope you received my
parcel by Rabbi Nissan if you can send me
any more of the Back Nos for which I wrote
you will oblige me, at the same time have
you any whole Nos as 1-2-3-4-5-6-7-8
I have none of these Vols. I should like to have
them either bound or unbound I shall then
be the only one in the Pacific Coast who will
have a regular file of them. Of course I will

pay for them. Please let me know what I
owe you up to the present, and I will hand
it to Mr Myers to whom I have spoken on
the subject. Religious matters here are of
no importance, all is quiet. Your April No
caused a great consternation among a certain
class who were delighted to find that these acts
were made known to the world, altho' they are
not able to prevent them of course the Gleaner
has its supporters as there are so many
who will do wrong in spite of every thing
you will no doubt see how the Gleaner
answers for itself. Not one thing satisfactory
because as you know Hebrew
still we must do our duty. The Letter
which he inserts is from one of the ladies
whom I refused to marry. I have no
doubt that the Gleaner managed this
matter to be ? Hebrew
but the truth was not stated therein and
if even all was true, what right had
Dr Eckman to marry her. He certainly does
not think I am greater than he is to act
in opposition to a Law because I or
any man ventures an opinion, which you
yourself can see how he shirks the question.

Many here surmise that I inform you of
all that passes—but I do not wish my name
to appear for many reasons—especially as
some of my members and other of the Hebrew
are friends to the Gleaner, and have pity on the poor old man as they call him x
that encourages him in all his doings—
I shall still inform you of all that passes
because I do think that ultimately by so
doing we shall in time affect some good
In the pulpit I speak of these things fearlessly
I will send you a sermon I preached on
the 1st day Hebrew by which you will see
that I do as I say and act upon the principle
Hebrew. Eckman does all he can to
injure me in the minds of the people as
my Election is only from year to year but
I tell my folks that my Hebrew is in God x
not in man, even the Reformers hold
me in respect altho' I tell them of their
wrongs. even Dr Cohn will not do such
things as these men do. He works hard with
me to get the people to keep Hebrew . I have
succeeded in one or two instances and I hope
in time we shall do more—but it is very difficult
the Dollars & cents are the main thing with
our people here—still we must do our duty

I must give you Credit for the very able
note you appended to the article &
I can assure you that all the Hebrew
here were pleased with it in the
hope that we may be Hebrew

some people here think that we should not
publish such matters as it brings us into
disrepute before the world and exposes
our religion to ridicule, they say better let
us chose between the two evils, and they
think that the “wrong doings” is the lesser
evil. I tell them plainly I differ from
them entirely upon the principle

and I feel assured that you think with
me in this respect and I should be pleased
if you think well of it to publish your
sentiments on the subject I will keep
you posted on all matters of any interest
Both congregations were well attended in
Hebrew. I am told that Dr Cohn delivered a
very impressive sermon in confirming a
number of Boys and Girls upon the new System
in the Reform World. My sermon I will send
you and judge for yourself my folks were very much
pleased. We had a Boy Hebrew on the 2nd day of

Hebrew. And read the Hebrew in the
old Orthodox Style to a crowded auditory
which gave great satisfaction. I still and
will adhere to our good old times and
will suffer no innovation, and I am happy
to say that with few exceptions my Hebrew
support me in this respect, altho' at
times I have to go into the Battle field
but I will and do not flinch. The Gleaner
being the only Jewish Organ here sometimes
rouses up one or two who go abroad
and say this is old and out of tune and
that causes mischief. I heed them not
and when I reason with them they are
silenced. I am so far fortunate that the
Board of Trustees tho' individually not
very ultra Orthodox yet they will not allow
any one to interfere with me in the synagogue
service, at the head of them is our Hebrew
an Englishman who has held office for
many years who is really a stanch Hebrew
and who never neglects to be in
Hebrew whenever service is performed
our Hebrew is opened every Hebrew and
three times an Hebrew and there you find
the Hebrew at his port and this has a

powerful influence with the congregation
in general when they see the President
setting the good example the old adage
“Hebrew”
The charitable Institutions among us
are flourishing and do much good
the people are certainly ready at all times
to dispense charity and that too liberally.
I believe now my dear sir I have
exhausted all my sources of information
and I hope I have not exhausted
your patience to read my long epistle
but I suppose you are like me at
times glad to get something fresh from
abroad however trifling

I leave you now in the hope that
this will reach you in health of mind
and Body and expect to hear from
you soon
